intro: Oropetium africanum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough texture, while its stems are succulent and can store water. Oropetium africanum is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural compounds with potential pharmacological applications.
